granted_ancillary.text: This gigantic, reanimated hulk of flesh, timber and stone is one of the most fearsome things ever to lurch onto a battlefield.

granted_ancillary.text: A Griffon is a majestic beast - part lion, part eagle, and extremely deadly and terrible to behold in battle, for the foe at least.

granted_ancillary.text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

granted_ancillary.text: Commandeered as a rider-less warhorse of a slain Knight, Suleman boldly charges Repanse into battle at the apex of her feared lance formation.

granted_ancillary.text: Dark Elf Beastmasters roam the wilds atop their dreaded chariots, armed with barbed nets and harpoons to slay the foe and ensnare their prey.

granted_ancillary.name: Spite
granted_ancillary.text: Larger than most others of its kind, the ferocious Cold One named 'Spite' is truly a creature fit for a heartless murderer like Malus Darkblade.

granted_ancillary.name: Mautererius
granted_ancillary.text: The Dragon Prince’s unwavering steed is bedecked in plates and scales of ‘sky-silver’ that mimic the appearance of a mighty Drake.

granted_ancillary.name: Minaithnir
granted_ancillary.text: Imrik’s fanatically loyal Drake is a symbol of the Elf Lord’s irrefutable eminence as the last true Dragon Prince.

granted_ancillary.text: The wild Griffons of Ulthuan are creatures of noble bearing and keen intelligence, with whom Elves form bonds that only death can shatter.

granted_ancillary.name: Arcane Phoenix
granted_ancillary.text: Fighting upon an Arcane Phoenix, Teclis rides the magical tempests, harnessing the power of the howling Winds sweeping through the world of mortals.

granted_ancillary.name: Brood Horror
granted_ancillary.text: For the gaudier Warlord, Clan Moulder offers their most bloated Pox Rats as mounts to flail, crush, and savage a way through the enemy’s ranks.

granted_ancillary.name: Bonebreaker
granted_ancillary.text: A specially-engineered breed of Rat Ogre, the Bonebreaker has a braced platform strapped or bolted to its back for carrying a Skaven Warlord to battle.

granted_ancillary.text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

granted_ancillary.name: Unicorn
granted_ancillary.text: Its forehead adorned with a spiral horn, this noble mount carries the Spellweaver where her magical gifts are needed most.

granted_ancillary.name: Great Eagle
granted_ancillary.text: Fly on your wings, like an eagle. Touch the sun. Track the foe, ambush, and defeat.

granted_ancillary.name: Blessing of Filth
granted_ancillary.text: This blessing manifests in horrific boils, undulating flesh and a terrible growth that renders the Beastmen near impossible to keep down.

granted_ancillary.name: Blessing of Mania
granted_ancillary.text: This blessing drives the Beastmen into a self-destructive mania, their desire for flesh so great that they must feast lest they dine upon themselves!

granted_ancillary.name: Blessing of Trickery
granted_ancillary.text: This blessing boils the very eyes of the Beastmen, creating great undulating clouds of steam that both obscures them and tears metal to shreds.

granted_ancillary.name: Tuskgor Chariot
granted_ancillary.text: Pugnacious and stubborn, the war beasts that pull these ramshackle chariots are grotesque combinations of great boar and mighty ram.

granted_ancillary.name: Klad Brakak
granted_ancillary.text: The runic energy within Thorek's mighty hammer builds and crackles, erupting in an earth-shattering thunderbolt.

granted_ancillary.name: Anvil of Doom
granted_ancillary.text: Covered in the Runelord’s ancient script, the anvil has given form to the most powerful runic weapons ever forged.

granted_ancillary.name: Thorek's Rune Armour
granted_ancillary.text: Thorek’s self-crafted armour can turn a Giant’s club, allowing the Runelord to walk unscathed through the flames of the Wyrm Drakamol.

granted_ancillary.name: Daemonbane
granted_ancillary.text: The ground crystals of Tzeentch's realm can imbue darts with the power to pierce any ward and find the weakest points on the most formidable foes.

granted_ancillary.name: Slow Death
granted_ancillary.text: Harvested from a rare flower found only in the most toxic corners of Nurgle's gardens, this poison ensures a long and painful death.

granted_ancillary.name: Fimir Linebreakers
granted_ancillary.text: These Fimir are devoted to the Troll King, taking up an unstoppable hammer formation to break open his foes.

granted_ancillary.name: Skin Wolf Stalkers
granted_ancillary.text: The unending hunger of the Skin Wolves need not be a curse, but a tool precisely applied where the Troll King decrees.

granted_ancillary.name: Troll Guardians
granted_ancillary.text: Uncannily cogent for Trolls, the Troll King's devoted form a bulwark around their king that breaks the charges of foolish cavalry.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Skeletal Steed
granted_ancillary.text: A Wight King was once a Chieftain or a warrior-king of his tribe and so may have been buried with a loyal steed that still wears its rusted barding.

granted_ancillary.name: Skeletal Steed
granted_ancillary.text: The Wight King calls forth a spectral steed of bone to ride upon, should he have favoured it during his once-lived life.

granted_ancillary.name: Cauldron of Blood
granted_ancillary.text: A gift from Khaine, containing the secret of eternal youth and beauty. His brides may bathe in it to renew their vitality.

granted_ancillary.name: Black Dragon
granted_ancillary.text: Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

granted_ancillary.name: Cold One
granted_ancillary.text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

granted_ancillary.name: Dark Pegasus
granted_ancillary.text: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

granted_ancillary.name: Dark Steed
granted_ancillary.text: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

granted_ancillary.name: Malhandhir
granted_ancillary.text: The finest Ellyrion steed, atop which Tyrion has single-handedly put verminous hordes to flight.

granted_ancillary.name: Cold One
granted_ancillary.text: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Lustria, tempted from their tropical jungles to bear the Lizardmen to battle.

granted_ancillary.name: Grymloq
granted_ancillary.text: Grymloq is Kroq-Gar's ageless Carnosaur, upon which the great Lizardman Lord has won all his many victories.

granted_ancillary.name: Horned One
granted_ancillary.text: Very rare and virtually extinct, even in Lustria, the Horned One's preternatural swiftness puts it way ahead of other Cold Ones.

granted_ancillary.name: Zlaaq
granted_ancillary.text: The largest Stegadon to be found anywhere, Zlaaq has served Lord Mazdamundi faithfully for almost five hundred years.

granted_ancillary.name: Carnosaur
granted_ancillary.text: The ultimate jungle hunters, these large, apex predators have terrorised the primordial jungles since the dawn of existence.

granted_ancillary.name: Cold One

granted_ancillary.name: Stegadon
granted_ancillary.text: Mighty, horned, reptilian beasts, Stegadons are naturally armoured with bony scales and spikes protruding from their crests.

granted_ancillary.name: Terradon
granted_ancillary.text: Dangerous predators with sharp talons and pointed beaks, these giant flying reptiles are surprisingly agile and can spot their prey at great distances.

granted_ancillary.name: Stegadon

granted_ancillary.name: Screaming Bell
granted_ancillary.text: An unholy battle altar dedicated to the Great Horned Rat, its ominous tolling strikes awe into evil Skaven hearts and fear into their opponents.

granted_ancillary.name: Screaming Bell
granted_ancillary.text: An unholy battle altar dedicated to the Great Horned Rat, its ominous tolling strikes awe into evil Skaven hearts and fear into their opponents.

granted_ancillary.name: Plague Furnace
granted_ancillary.text: This altar, ridden with disease, is a fitting pulpit from which the Plague Priests preach their words of poison and death.

granted_ancillary.name: Bonebreaker
granted_ancillary.text: A specially-engineered breed of Rat Ogre, the Bonebreaker has a braced platform strapped or bolted to its back for carrying a Skaven Warlord to battle.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Battle Wizards are rarely armoured for it interferes with their casting, yet a steed can and should be barded to add a level of protection.

granted_ancillary.name: Imperial Pegasus
granted_ancillary.text: Imperial Pegasi are found in Grey Mountains where Bretonnian and Empire hunters fight over capturing the foals.

granted_ancillary.name: Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

granted_ancillary.name: War Boar
granted_ancillary.text: The war boar is a stubborn and vicious animal - an extremely tough beast that is notoriously bad tempered, loudly flatulent, unpredictable, and wholly dangerous.

granted_ancillary.name: Arachnarok Spider (Catchweb Spidershrine)
granted_ancillary.text: This enormous, revolting Arachnarok Spider shrine upon which the Shaman is borne forces even the branches of nearby trees to twist in revulsion at its diabolical passing.

granted_ancillary.name: Elven Steed
granted_ancillary.text: The bond between rider and steed goes beyond friendship or family; they act as one.

granted_ancillary.name: Great Eagle

granted_ancillary.name: Great Stag
granted_ancillary.text: With its magnificent frame and the great plumes of steam of its snorting breath, the Great Stag instils unflinching valour into those who ride it.

granted_ancillary.name: Bracchus
granted_ancillary.text: No creature outmatches the Black Dragon Bracchus in terms of sheer cruelty and the ability to inflict pain, save for Rakarth himself!

granted_ancillary.name: Manticore
granted_ancillary.text: Dark Elves hold no creature in higher esteem than the Manticore, for they believe it to be one of the thousand incarnations of Khaine.

granted_ancillary.name: Scourgerunner Chariot
granted_ancillary.text: Dark Elf Beastmasters roam the wilds atop their dreaded chariots, armed with barbed nets and harpoons to slay the foe and ensnare their prey.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Chaos Steed
granted_ancillary.text: The steeds of Chaos are vicious mounts enveloped in thick plate barding - coal-black chargers infused with Daemon blood and a temperament to match.

granted_ancillary.name: Chaos Steed
granted_ancillary.text: The dread steeds of Chaos are more than mere horses, but creatures tainted by Daemon blood, said to be gifts from the Dark Gods themselves.

granted_ancillary.name: Manticore
granted_ancillary.text: Manticores are huge leonine beasts with the wings of a giant bat and tails the drip with poison. They are the fiercest of all Chaotic mounts.

granted_ancillary.text: A deadly mountain of muscle and hair, forced to pull its Beastlord’s chariot, is a truly repulsive proposition indeed.

granted_ancillary.text: Not all horses that roam the northlands are Chaos steeds, but even mortal stallions from the north are proud beasts worthy of any Chieftain.

granted_ancillary.name: Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Not all horses that roam the northlands are Chaos steeds, but even mortal stallions from the north are proud beasts worthy of any Lord.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Barded horses offer greater protection; a large horse is needed to support the armour rig, usually purchased from massive breeds found in the Empire.

granted_ancillary.name: Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Officers of the lesser kingdoms will use their considerable wealth to purchase fine Bretonnian stallions, befitting their standing.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Barded horses offer greater protection, a large horse is needed to support the armour, usually purchased from massive breeds found in the Empire.

granted_ancillary.name: Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Officers of the lesser kingdoms will use their considerable wealth to purchase fine Bretonnian stallions, befitting their standing.

granted_ancillary.name: Warhorse
granted_ancillary.text: Should a Battle Wizard need a mount, then his station would ensure he receives a warhorse of good breed.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Skeletal Steed
granted_ancillary.text: A Wight King was once a Chieftain or a warrior-king of his tribe and so may have been buried with a loyal steed that still wears its rusted barding.

granted_ancillary.name: Skeletal Steed
granted_ancillary.text: The Wight King calls forth a spectral steed of bone to ride upon, should he have favoured it during his once-lived life.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Nightmare
granted_ancillary.text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

granted_ancillary.name: Hellsteed
granted_ancillary.text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Nightmare
granted_ancillary.text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

granted_ancillary.name: Hellsteed
granted_ancillary.text: Hellsteeds are winged Nightmares; Mannfred’s personal mount is said to have been the horse of an arch enemy.

granted_ancillary.name: Zombie Dragon
granted_ancillary.text: Mannfred has taken to flying into battle upon the back of a mighty zombie dragon, a drake he recently slew and returned to Unlife.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Nightmare
granted_ancillary.text: A powerful Necromancer may be deemed worthy to ride on once-proud steeds, now risen to become Nightmares clad in dread barding.

granted_ancillary.name: Hellsteed
granted_ancillary.text: Should the Necromancers please their Vampire masters they may well be gifted with Hellsteeds - winged Nightmares.

granted_ancillary.name: Barded Nightmare
granted_ancillary.text: The steeds of the Midnight Aristocracy are unnatural destriers called Nightmares. They are Undead stallions clad in baroque barding.

granted_ancillary.name: Hellsteed
granted_ancillary.text: Hellsteeds are the unholy fusion of horse and giant bat, bound by Dark Magic - a fitting steed for a Vampire noble.

granted_ancillary.name: Zombie Dragon
granted_ancillary.text: Animated by Dark Magic, a zombie dragon is an unholy parody of a once-noble beast now borne aloft by great tattered wings, its body covered with thick, withered hide.

granted_ancillary.name: Nightmare
granted_ancillary.text: Some Nightmares are the long-dead carcasses of dead warhorses, brought back to life through necromantic magic.
